etymology.description: Semantic: 亻(人) (rén, "person") + Phonetic: 尃(尃) (fū, "disperse") = person skilled in dispersing knowledge -> instructor
etymology.interpretation: The character 傅(傅) (fù) represents someone who disperses or spreads knowledge, embodying the role of a teacher or tutor. The 人(亻) (rén, "person") component indicates that the term relates to a person, while 尃(尃) (fū, "disperse") suggests the action of communicating or spreading understanding.

examples.chinese: 我的傅很耐心(我的傅很耐心)。
他是我最敬爱的傅(他是我最敬愛的傅)，总是仔细讲解(總是仔細講解)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì wǒ zuì jìng'ài de fù, zǒng shì zǐxì jiǎngjiě.
examples.english: He is my most respected tutor, always explaining carefully.

examples.chinese: 课堂上傅的讲解清晰(課堂上傅的講解清晰)。
examples.pinyin: Kètáng shàng fù de jiǎngjiě qīngxī.
examples.english: The tutor's explanations in class are clear.
